content.description: Begin on slightly broken rock up to good holds up to a ledge about half way up the wall.
content.location: Trail Side routes along prospectors trail.  To the right of the tree.

content.description: Begin on some broken looking rock for the first 6 feet.  Move onto solid terrain and begin working your way up sustained climbing to a tricky press move near the top.  Excellent climbing for the grade.
content.location: This is the furthest climber's right route (coming from stateline) on business time crag.

content.description: Fun and interesting slab climbing.  Begin in a mini-dihedral to some better face holds.  Work past the obvious slab crux mid-route into better holds and anchors.
content.location: Turn uphill (climber's left) after the business time roof (coming form stateline)  This is the furthest uphill sport route on this wall.

content.description: Begin on big holds to a ledge at the second bolt.  Slab, Undercling, and lie-back an excellent banana shaped dihedral to exit back onto the face.
content.location: Turn Climber's left up the hill after the roof (coming from stateline) This is the route with the obvious golden dihedral feature.

content.description: This route starts in the dihedral before going up the hill.  Climb up and onto the face on deceivingly pumpy moves.  Get past the mid-way crux into a pleasant finish.
content.location: Turn left directly after the business time roof (coming from state line).  This route begins in the dihedral before going uphill.

content.description: This route begins climbing a spine until it rolls left onto the face.  Pretty route for the grade.
content.location: Trailside route on prospectors in business time area.  75' past the business time roof on prospectors coming from stateline.

content.description: Climbs stair stepping holds into a tricky depression to gain a ledge mid-way up the wall.
content.location: Trail Side routes - 75' past business time roof along prospectors trail (coming from stateline)

climbs.name: Business In The Front Party In The Back

content.description: This is the first route in the Business Time Crag if your coming from the state line second tier.  The route starts in a dihedral that then traverses out the roof and makes a juggy but big rock over move to exit the roof and gain the face (crux).  After that the route ascends copius jugs and sculpted sandstone for 50 ft. to the anchors.  not a classic, but you'll leave this one saying "well, that was pretty good".
content.protection: Bolts+ Anchors (may still need quicklinks on anchor bolts)
content.location: Business time under roof.  See above description.

content.description: Start this route on the far left side of the ledge about 6' off the ground.  Follow the obvious crack feature along clean smooth rock with wonderfully interesting holds.
content.location: Turn left after business time roof (coming from state line).  Look for obvious crack feature.

content.description: This is a shady little nook of easy-moderate climbing along prospectors trail just past the state line 2nd tier wall.  It is a new area as of August 2019--be aware of new routes.
